DataElement.preferredName: Person Last Known Alive Disease Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A condition or state of disease for a person when last known alive.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining._Recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge._The organic phenomenon that distinguishes living organisms from nonliving ones; showing characteristics of life._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredName: Last Known Life Disease or Disorder
Property.preferredDefinition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:Recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge.:The organic phenomenon that distinguishes living organisms from nonliving ones; showing characteristics of life.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.
Recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge.
Showing characteristics of life; displaying signs of life.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.
